intro: Casearia cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and lance-shaped. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, fleshy fruits. Casearia cuspidata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
